message.content:
A clever question!

We know that 10 pairs (20 socks) took 10 hours to dry, so the drying rate is constant. To find the time it takes to dry 7 pairs (14 socks), we can set up a proportion:

Time taken for 20 socks = Time taken for 14 socks × (Number of socks / Total number of socks)

Let x be the time taken for 7 pairs (14 socks) to dry.

Time taken for 20 socks = 10 hours
Total number of socks = 20 + 14 = 34

Now, substitute these values into the proportion:

10 = x × (14 / 34)
10 = x × (2/3.5)
x = 15 hours

So, it will take Tom approximately 15 hours to dry seven pairs of socks under the same weather conditions.
